author: D. Peter Boucher, Kt. SMOM, International Master Mariner (retd.)
content:
Boca Jim you may want to think about that again. Their was no way for these animals to be fed so they were being saved from agonizing deaths by starvation. One doubts very much that Shackleton was a cruel man rather quite the reverse.

Good Watch.

author: D. Peter Boucher, Kt. SMOM, International Master Mariner (retd.)
content:
Nice to see John Molloy’s comment. He and I both served our Deck Apprenticeship in Irish Shipping Ltd. in the 1950,s.

Due to Ireland not being a free country in those days many of our nationals, including Shackleton himself, accomplishments were credited as “British”.

Good Watch.

author: Boca Jim
content: Linda, Shackleton killed the cat, as well as the expedition’s sled dogs, before departing the site of the Endurance’s sinking. A cruel man to be sure.
